answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some examples of the type of marketing you are looking for.
Clare County, Ireland has a development plan posted online and in it they discuss their options of promoting the wind power available on their coastlines. This section in particular can be found on page 7.
http://www.clarecoco.ie/planning/publications/clare-county-development-plan-2011-2017-summary-10053.pdf
Another popular way of developing the local economy through what is already there is using Agro- tourism. This has become a good way to help bring business to failing farms and develop farm land.
http://www.culturalheritagetourism.org/successstories/minnesota.htm
I also included a document about the best ways to market natural resources in general which may be helpful.
http://www.naturalresources.msstate.edu/business/marketing.html
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Eric Kline
text: Is anyone aware of a specific city, county or region which, in the past couple of decades, has marketed itself to attract businesses by emphasizing its natural resources, such as abundant water supplies?  I'm not really concerned with the wonderful projects that some cities have undertaken to revitalize and market their waterfront districts nor with the resource of hydro-forces, so much as with the availabilty of plenty of water (or wind or easily developed real estate which is not vulnerable to natural disaster) - any resource which would have a general interest to many types of industries.  Obviously, a mining community could market to businesses relating to the resource being mined, but I'm looking for a broader spectrum than this.  Thoughts?  and thank you.
title: Marketing natural resources for business development
